content: mon petit violon designs © 2014  any sport weight yarn approx 50g for smaller size and up to 100g for bigger sizes i used linen/viscose blend yarn but any other yarn will work just fine with the yarn weight you can also make experiments and use some thicker yarn as well in this case you will simply have to make less squares  crochet hook 3 25mm d or size needed to obtain gauge  4 small buttons can use only 2 if prefer  tapestry needle  fabric two pieces each 15x18inches for baby size or 18x21inches for toddler size  4 stitch markers optional you can use contrasting color yarn as well to mark stitches  pins optional  sewing machine optional all seams can be hand sewn as well 11dc and 5 row = 2inches st s stitch es chain chain stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch this tutorial was made in collaboration with la tessoria 3-double_crochet bobble- work 3 incomplete double_crochet stitches by leaving the last tutorial is written for two sizes but it is extremely easy to loop of each stitch on hook so that 4 loops remain on hook make it in any other size all you need to do is to make as yarn over and draw through all loops on hook stitch many squares as needed to make it fit around child s chest completed and then cut the fabric according to your own measurements desired length and width of the skirt part baby 9-12months toddler up to 3 years 4-double_crochet bobble - work 4 incomplete double_crochet stitches by leaving the last loop of each stitch on hook so that 5 loops remain on hook yarn over and draw through all loops on hook stitch completed foundation ring ch4 join round 1 ch4 counts as first double_crochet and ch1 *double_crochet into the ring ch1* repeat from * 10 times more join with slip_stitch in first double_crochet make 8 for baby size and 10 for toddler size or as many as needed for any other size or if using different kind of yarn first i suggest to weave in the ends which remained at the centre of each square with other ends we will deal later now you have to join the squares rnd2 slip_stitch in first chain-1 space ch2 3-double_crochet bobble in same chain-1 starting from the treble_crochet on the angle of the square join both pieces space working single_crochet evenly across *ch2 4-double_crochet bobble in next chain-1 space ch3 treble_crochet in next double_crochet ch3 4- sure there are many different ways how to join the squares and double_crochet bobble in next chain-1 space ch2 4-double_crochet bobble in next chain-1 this one is probably the most primitive way but it works well space* and i am totally happy with the result repeat from * twice more ch2 4-double_crochet bobble in next chain-1 space only in case you are using much thicker yarn like worsted ch3 treble_crochet in next double_crochet
